channel.title: The Hodljuice Daily Pint
channel.itunes:author: curated by Hodljuice
channel.description: Daily collection of various Bitcoin-related podcasts

item.title: Bitcoin Audible: Chat 127 - The Hijacking Bitcoin Debate [Liberty Lockdown]
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Audible
item.itunes:keywords: Heated debate, Bitcoin's direction, Influence of Michael Saylor, Community concerns
item.description: This episode features a heated debate regarding the direction of Bitcoin, focusing on Michael Saylor's influence and the notion of Bitcoin being hijacked. The discussion involves co-author of "Hijacking Bitcoin," Steve Patterson, leading to passionate exchanges about crucial issues in the Bitcoin community.

item.title: Bitcoin Park: NEMS25: Mining in the Bush Panel Discussion
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Park
item.itunes:keywords: Off-grid mining, Community engagement, Logistical challenges, Economic impact
item.description: This conversation delves into off-grid mining, addressing challenges faced by miners in remote locations. Speakers share personal experiences, emphasizing innovation, community involvement, and the positive impacts of mining on local economies.

item.title: Bitcoin Veterans: Bitcoin Veterans: Josh with Pura Vida Bitcoin Costa Rica
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin Veterans
item.itunes:keywords: Local Bitcoin adoption, Security, Community insights, Education
item.description: Josh from Pura Vida Bitcoin Costa Rica discusses his efforts in promoting Bitcoin adoption in the region, stressing the importance of security and local engagement. The conversation provides practical insights into the Bitcoin community and its growth in Costa Rica.

item.title: Bitcoin for Millennials: Ex-Sotheby’s CEO: Bitcoin Changed Everything I Knew About Money | Tad Smith | BFM126
item.itunes:author: Bitcoin for Millennials
item.itunes:keywords: Transition to crypto, Financial education, Wealth dynamics, Investment strategies
item.description: Tad Smith, a former CEO, shares insights from his transition into the crypto space, highlighting the importance of financial awareness and the challenges posed by traditional finance. The episode discusses the evolving landscape of investments and the role of Bitcoin in modern finance.

item.title: Bitcorner with Juan Cienfuegos: Tania Lea: ¿Bitcoin tan fácil como una tarjeta de regalo?
item.itunes:author: Bitcorner with Juan Cienfuegos
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin adoption, Financial education, Impact in Latin America, Inclusive finance
item.description: Tania Lea discusses Azteco's platform for purchasing Bitcoin through gift cards, highlighting its role in promoting adoption while tackling the challenges of financial education in Latin America. The episode emphasizes the significance of providing accessible solutions for Bitcoin inclusion.

item.title: Coin Stories: Paula Pendley: The Intersection of Bitcoin, AI, & Legal Power Plays
item.itunes:author: Coin Stories
item.itunes:keywords: Legal concerns, Bitcoin mining, Mainstream perception, Technology
item.description: Attorney Paula Pendley discusses the legal challenges surrounding Bitcoin, particularly nuisance lawsuits against miners and Bitcoin’s potential value in mainstream contexts. Her background in high-stakes legal battles provides insights into the intersection of Bitcoin and law.

item.title: Galaxy Brains: The New SEC w/ Hester Peirce
item.itunes:author: Galaxy Brains
item.itunes:keywords: Regulatory landscape, Crypto task force, SEC priorities, Blockchain innovations
item.description: Commissioner Hester Peirce shares insights on SEC’s priorities and its regulated approach to cryptocurrency, discussing recent struggles and future plans, including the potential for blockchain to be integrated with stocks.

item.title: I Am Texas Slim: Bird Flu, Beef Imports, and the Future of Food: A Conversation with Texas Slim & Vaccine Safety Research Foundation
item.itunes:author: I Am Texas Slim
item.itunes:keywords: Food sovereignty, Biosecurity, Agriculture concerns, Community solutions
item.description: This episode examines the impact of the bird flu crisis on American agriculture, discussing the implications of USDA mandates and the push for mRNA vaccines in livestock. The dialogue emphasizes building trust with local ranchers as a way to promote food independence.

item.title: Onramp Media: The Banks Are Coming: Why Building Custodial Trust is Imperative
item.itunes:author: Onramp Media
item.itunes:keywords: Bitcoin custody, Market trends, Financial products, Security
